sentences: Meie teeme koostööd ja me anname üksteisele abi.
context: The word 'annavad' is the 3rd person plural present form of the Estonian verb 'anna', which means 'to give'. It translates to English as they give/we give (depending on context). This verb indicates the action of providing something to someone or something else. In Estonian, this verb follows standard conjugation patterns with different forms for different persons and tenses.
